main.h1: Regulations on restrictions for Russian flights

article.article: The purpose of these regulations is to adopt a restricted area within Norwegian airspace containing certain restrictions for Russian flights.
These regulations apply to airspace over the territory of Norway within Polaris FIR.

These regulations apply to all aircraft operated by Russian air carriers, including as a marketing carrier in code-sharing or blocked-space arrangements, or for any Russian registered aircraft, or for any non-Russian-registered aircraft which is owned or chartered, or otherwise controlled by any Russian natural or legal person, entity or body.

It is prohibited for any aircraft operated by Russian air carriers, including as a marketing carrier in code-sharing or blocked-space arrangements, or for any Russian registered aircraft, or for any non-Russian-registered aircraft which is owned or chartered, or otherwise controlled by any Russian natural or legal person, entity or body, to land in, take off from or overfly the territory of Norway.
Paragraph 1 shall not apply in the case of an emergency landing or an emergency overflight.

Luftfartstilsynet may authorise an aircraft to land in, take off from, or overfly, the territory of Norway if they have determined that such landing, take-off or overflight is required for humanitarian purposes or for any other purpose consistent with the objectives of these regulations. Any application must be submitted to traffic@caa.no at least 48 hours before flight.
These regulations shall enter into force 28 February 2022, 09:15 (local time).
